name: Old Man Flynn
greeting: OLD MAN FLYNN: Did you know They Know?

options.responseText: OLD MAN FLYNN: I knew it! I knew someone would know! That brace looks like it needs a fair polishing. Let me give it a fair polishing, my son.
You nod politely and keep moving. They continue to know.
OLD MAN FLYNN: You... don't know? Then I have nothing to discuss with you.

options.text: 'From what I heard, they do NOT know, actually.'
options.responseText: Old Man Flynn uses his cane to bop you on the head. He then walks away.

SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: You can see me?! No one has talked to me or looked at me in 50 years. Oh heavens this is incredible. I spend my days and nights sleeping and tending to various pieces of armor. All day. All Night. You have given me hope. Here, take this bracer. Its my best yet.
SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: Howdy.
SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: Howdy.
SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: Howdy.

name: Old Guy Accardi
greeting: OLD GUY ACCARDI: Have you seen my dog? His name is Artie. Honestly, heâ€™ll eat any food. He even eats the tops of strawberries. Also, he likes two clicks at the same time.

options.text: 'I have not seen him, but if I do, I'll run back here and let you know.'
options.responseText: OLD GUY ACCARDI: That's what's up. Thanks for telling me. As a reward, here is a sealed Health Potion I found earlier.
You nod politely and keep moving. You feel guilt because you DID in fact see Artie a few clicks ago. I hope you lose sleep.

Old Guy Accardi's smile turns to a deep and angry scowl. He says, 'You're going to eat those words,' makes a ton of noise to attract unwanted attention, and then throws a smoke bomb at his feet. He is now gone and in his place is something ready to kill you.

options.text: 'Yes. I saw him a few clicks back that way. Gave him a couple of pets on the noggin, I did.'
options.responseText: OLD GUY ACCARDI: That's what's up. Thank you for looking out. Here is a finder's fee.

name: TJ the Golden
greeting: TJ THE GOLDEN: Take a seat, will ya? I am cracking beers and listening to Steely Dan.

options.text: Take a seat, crack a beer, and listen to Steely Dan
options.responseText: Your mind and body are restored by a father's kindness and you gain +5 HP, and your vision is blurry from the delicious beer.

options.text: 'No thanks, I only like to Imagine the Dragon I am going to fight later.'
options.responseText: TJ THE GOLDEN: Alright. Suit yourself, padre.

options.text: 'No thanks, I have no time to learn the saxophone.'
options.responseText: TJ THE GOLDEN: They got a name for the winners in the world. I hope you have a name for when you lose.
Your mind and body are restored by a father's kindness and you gain +5 HP, and your vision is blurry from the delicious beer.

name: Fairwyn the Tongueless
greeting: FAIRWYN THE TONGUELESS: Oouu eeeahh ouu! Eerrr eh ah eehahee!!!

options.text: 'Did you say 'Look behind you, there is an enemy?'
options.responseText: There was, in fact, an enemy behind you.
You should have listened. An enemy appears, hits you with its claws, and runs away. You take damage.
You should have listened. An enemy appears, hits you with its claws, and runs away. You take damage.

options.text: 'I believe you with all of my soul even if I didn't understand what you said.'
options.responseText: You must have rested well last night because you knew what he meant before his tongueless mouth started flapping. You take your weapon and dig it into the enemy's skull, immediately dropping it back into the hell it came from, and you gain +5 HP.

name: Evil Tom
greeting: EVIL TOM: My name is Evil Tom. I'm a really nice guy. ðŸ˜ƒ

options.responseText: EVIL TOM: Well, I never!
Evil Tom sneezes and vanishes in a puff of smoke, leaving only a pair of old Crocs. The Crocs hurt to look at and deal 5 damage.
Evil Tom coughs so hard he accidentally punches you in the face and you take 5 damage.

options.text: 'You should change your name to Nice Tom then.'
options.responseText: EVIL TOM: Thank you. There is a lack of kindness in this world, and it's nice to meet someone who is counter to the culture. Here is some fresh bread.

name: Suttree The Old Mage
greeting: SUTTREE THE OLD MAGE: You look tired, traveler. Care for some arcane tea?

options.responseText: You feel energy surging through your veins.
You nod respectfully and continue on your way.
You nod disrespectfully and continue on your way.

options.text: Out of distrust of the world you live in, punch the Old Mage in the face.
options.responseText: The Mage doesn't seem to move or appear affected by your attack. However, your fist now aches. You move on awkwardly, losing -1 damage.

name: Daniel the Map Seller
greeting: DANIEL THE MAP GIVER: I give maps. Not much else.

options.responseText: It appears the map contains a shortcut through the upcoming brush. Your click count is reduced by 3.

options.text: 'The only guidance I need is from the sun and the stars.'
options.responseText: DANIEL THE MAP SELLER: Cool.
DANIEL THE MAP SELLER: Just maps.

options.text: Give me that compass or else I will make you pay!
options.responseText: DANIEL THE MAP SELLER: Ok, geeze... Here you go, man. Relax.

name: The Lost Bartender
greeting: THE LOST BARTENDER: Howdy, sir. How has your journey been? Never mind, forget I asked. Asking a man a question is the biggest true form of weakness, and I have been known to be a strong guy. Here, have a rip of this swill, won't you? I also have knives and guns and bullets you can drink if you want to.

options.text: Take a rip of the swill
options.responseText: Goes down smooth. Rips ya up on the inside in a good way.

options.text: Drink the guns, knives, and bullets.
options.responseText: THE LOST BARTENDER: Honestly, what did you expect? That's on you.

options.text: Take the guns, knives, and bullets and duct tape them to your chainmail gloves.
options.responseText: THE LOST BARTENDER: Very interesting.
THE LOST BARTENDER: Not even one knife? Okay then, pal.

name: Ron Von Zarovich
greeting: RON VON ZAROVICH: Bobby Lasagna is not to be trusted. I would sooner trust Strahd Von Zarovich over Bobby L. She lives in a hut and she killed my friend who once turned into a T-Rex.

options.responseText: RON VON ZAROVICH: Wow... Is this loss?
RON VON ZAROVICH: You could try. Here is some help. You'll end up vampire food, I fear. Good luck.

options.text: 'You shouldn't talk about your relations that way.'
options.responseText: RON VON ZAROVICH: You don't understand.

options.text: 'Well, if you think you are going to die, then maybe I can have your gold.'
options.responseText: RON VON ZAROVICH: Sure. What does it matter? These are the end times.

name: Miss Riddlesworth
greeting: MISS RIDDLESWORTH: You see me once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years. What am I?

options.responseText: MISS RIDDLESWORTH: Wrong!
MISS RIDDLESWORTH: H- How did you guess?
MISS RIDDLESWORTH: Not a chance!
MISS RIDDLESWORTH: You could not be more incorrect.

name: Mr Riddlesworth
greeting: MR RIDDLESWORTH: I build up castles, I tear down mountains. I make some men blind, I help others to see. What am I?

options.responseText: MR RIDDLESWORTH: Incorrect!
MR RIDDLESWORTH: Well, that's not the answer.
MR RIDDLESWORTH: You got it!
MR RIDDLESWORTH: Wrong!

name: The Scroll Dealer
greeting: THE SCROLL DEALER: If you're tired of looking at the same rocks and trees, then I may have a scroll for you...

options.responseText: THE SCROLL DEALER: Be careful out there...

name: Lord Bruenor Battlehammer
greeting: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Good sir, I am Lord Bruenor Battlehammer, Lord of these lands and heir of King Bort Battlehammer. I confess I am lost. I understand being lost and a Lord of this land seems like something a crazy beggar would say, but I implore you, I am telling the truth! You seem like you know these lands better than most. Please, tell me which direction would be Castle Battlehammer?

options.text: 'My Lord, go past those bushes over there and through the clearing. You will be able to see your castle in the distance.'
options.responseText: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Thank you, my dear friend. Here is a Turkey Leg from my finest Turkey. Come by any time and we can dine on a full Turkey!

options.text: 'This path will lead you there safely. You will just have to head the other direction, My Lord.'
options.responseText: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Thank you, my dear friend. Come visit me anytime and I will show you how to harness the power of your highest ability!

options.text: 'These things happen, My Lord. However, I seem to be just as lost as you are, sadly.'
options.responseText: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Thank you, my dear friend. Come visit me anytime and we will improve that sword of yours!

options.text: You distrust the raving madman. Why would a Lord of the lands be lost? You decide to attack the lunatic with your weapon.
options.responseText: It seems he was telling the truth. Off to jail you go, I suppose.

name: The Lighthouse Tavern
greeting: Just ahead, you spot a one-story building with what looks like a tall structure built to the left. The structure resembles a lighthouse. There is a handmade sign attached to the structure that says 'The Lighthouse Tavern'. You infer the tall structure is where this place got its name. Walking into the bar, there are a few patrons: a farmhand, a dwarf, and a mysterious man sitting in the shadows. The barkeep smiles at you. The bartender appears to be selling Beer and Boiled Peanuts. As you approach the bar, the mysterious man appears to also have something for sale...

options.text: Buy a beer from the Barkeep (10 Gold)
options.responseText: 'I'll take a Beer, please.'.
I'll take a Hardtack, please.

options.text: Buy the mysterious item from the Mysterious Man
options.responseText: The item looks like a normal compass, except it's glowing slightly. You walk outside with the compass, and without warning, you are transported to another area.
THE BARKEEP: Be careful of the goblins on this road, traveler.

options.text: 'Hey I think a guy is looking for you.'
options.responseText: The dog doesn't appear to be a dog after all and morphs into a disgusting creature.
The dog doesn't appear to be a dog after all and morphs into a disgusting creature.
The dog doesn't appear to be a dog after all and morphs into a disgusting creature.
You must have smelled something fishy because the dog was an enemy in disguise. The 'dog' dies immediately and drops a Turkey Leg, for some reason.

name: Dead Body
greeting: In front of you, there is a dead body. You recognize the person as Dr. Agula, a doctor from your village. Dr. Agula does not appear to have decayed much which indicates this may have happened recently. You hear about witches in this area and wonder if thats what did him in. The Doctor is out, it seems.

options.responseText: You take the dead man's Padded Armor
You take the dead man's gold.

options.text: Dig through some ditches and bury the Doctor. Say a prayer, swear you will burn through whatever witches did this to the Doctor and move on.
options.responseText: 'Rest in Peace, Rob Agula.'
Nothing Happens because its a dead body.
